class reversion.admin.VersionMetaAdmin(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: reversion.admin.VersionAdmin

An enhanced VersionAdmin that annotates the given object with information about the last version that was saved.

get_date_modified(obj)[source]¶

Displays the last modified date of the given object, typically for use in a change list.

media¶
queryset(request)[source]¶

Returns the annotated queryset.

helpers¶

A number of useful helper functions to automate common tasks.

reversion.helpers.generate_diffs(old_version, new_version, field_name, cleanup)[source]¶

Generates a diff array for the named field between the two versions.

reversion.helpers.generate_patch(old_version, new_version, field_name, cleanup=None)[source]¶

Generates a text patch of the named field between the two versions.

The cleanup parameter can be None, “semantic” or “efficiency” to clean up the diff for greater human readibility.

reversion.helpers.generate_patch_html(old_version, new_version, field_name, cleanup=None)[source]¶

Generates a pretty html version of the differences between the named field in two versions.

The cleanup parameter can be None, “semantic” or “efficiency” to clean up the diff for greater human readibility.

reversion.helpers.patch_admin(model, admin_site=None)[source]¶

Enables version control with full admin integration for a model that has already been registered with the django admin site.

This is excellent for adding version control to existing Django contrib applications.

middleware¶

Middleware used by Reversion.

class reversion.middleware.RevisionMiddleware[source]¶

Bases: object

Wraps the entire request in a revision.

Closes the revision.

process_response(request, response)[source]¶

Closes the revision.

Checks that no other signal receivers have been connected.

reversion.models.deprecated(original, replacement)[source]¶

Decorator that defines a deprecated method.

reversion.models.has_int_pk(model)[source]¶

Tests whether the given model has an integer primary key.

reversion.models.safe_revert(versions)[source]¶

Attempts to revert the given models contained in the give versions.

This method will attempt to resolve dependencies between the versions to revert them in the correct order to avoid database integrity errors.

revisions¶

Revision management for django-reversion.

exception reversion.revisions.RegistrationError[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

Exception thrown when registration with django-reversion goes wrong.

class reversion.revisions.RevisionContext(context_manager, manage_manually)[source]¶

Bases: object

An individual context for a revision.

class reversion.revisions.RevisionContextManager[source]¶

Bases: thread._local

Manages the state of the current revision.

add_meta(cls, **kwargs)[source]¶

Adds a class of meta information to the current revision.

add_to_context(manager, obj, version_data)[source]¶

Adds an object to the current revision.

clear()[source]¶

Puts the revision manager back into its default state.

create_revision(manage_manually=False)[source]¶

Marks up a block of code as requiring a revision to be created.

The returned context manager can also be used as a decorator.

end()[source]¶

Ends a revision for this thread.

get_comment()[source]¶

Gets the current comment for the revision.

get_db()[source]¶

Returns the current DB alias being used.

get_ignore_duplicates()[source]¶

Gets whether to ignore duplicate revisions.

get_user()[source]¶

Gets the current user for the revision.

invalidate()[source]¶

Marks this revision as broken, so should not be commited.

is_active()[source]¶

Returns whether there is an active revision for this thread.

is_invalid()[source]¶

Checks whether this revision is invalid.

is_managing_manually()[source]¶

Returns whether this revision context has manual management enabled.

set_comment(comment)[source]¶

Sets the comments for the revision.

set_db(db)[source]¶

Sets the DB alias to use.

set_ignore_duplicates(ignore_duplicates)[source]¶

Sets whether to ignore duplicate revisions.

set_user(user)[source]¶

Sets the current user for the revision.

start(manage_manually=False)[source]¶

Begins a revision for this thread.

This MUST be balanced by a call to end. It is recommended that you leave these methods alone and instead use the revision context manager or the create_on_success decorator.

exception reversion.revisions.RevisionManagementError[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

Exception that is thrown when something goes wrong with revision managment.

class reversion.revisions.RevisionManager(manager_slug, revision_context_manager=<reversion.revisions.RevisionContextManager object at 0x10829ef58>)[source]¶

Bases: object

Manages the configuration and creation of revisions.

comment¶
get_adapter(model)[source]¶

Returns the registration information for the given model class.

classmethod get_created_managers()[source]¶

Returns all created revision managers.

get_deleted(model_class, db=None, model_db=None)[source]¶

Returns all the deleted versions for the given model class.

The results are returned with the most recent versions first.

get_for_date(object, date, db=None)[source]¶

Returns the latest version of an object for the given date.

get_for_object(obj, db=None)[source]¶

Returns all the versions of the given object, ordered by date created.

The results are returned with the most recent versions first.

get_for_object_reference(model, object_id, db=None)[source]¶

Returns all versions for the given object reference.

The results are returned with the most recent versions first.

classmethod get_manager(manager_slug)[source]¶

Returns the manager with the given slug.

get_registered_models()[source]¶

Returns an iterable of all registered models.

get_unique_for_object(obj, db=None)[source]¶

Returns unique versions associated with the object.

The results are returned with the most recent versions first.

django.contrib.messages¶

api¶

django.contrib.messages.api.add_message(request, level, message, extra_tags='', fail_silently=False)[source]¶

Attempts to add a message to the request using the ‘messages’ app.

django.contrib.messages.api.get_messages(request)[source]¶

Returns the message storage on the request if it exists, otherwise returns an empty list.

django.contrib.messages.api.get_level(request)[source]¶

Returns the minimum level of messages to be recorded.

The default level is the MESSAGE_LEVEL setting. If this is not found, the INFO level is used.

django.contrib.messages.api.set_level(request, level)[source]¶

Sets the minimum level of messages to be recorded, returning True if the level was recorded successfully.

If set to None, the default level will be used (see the get_level method).

django.contrib.messages.api.debug(request, message, extra_tags='', fail_silently=False)[source]¶

Adds a message with the DEBUG level.

django.contrib.messages.api.info(request, message, extra_tags='', fail_silently=False)[source]¶

Adds a message with the INFO level.

django.contrib.messages.api.success(request, message, extra_tags='', fail_silently=False)[source]¶

Adds a message with the SUCCESS level.

django.contrib.messages.api.warning(request, message, extra_tags='', fail_silently=False)[source]¶

Adds a message with the WARNING level.

django.contrib.messages.api.error(request, message, extra_tags='', fail_silently=False)[source]¶

Adds a message with the ERROR level.

context_processors¶

django.contrib.messages.context_processors.messages(request)[source]¶

Returns a lazy ‘messages’ context variable.

middleware¶

class django.contrib.messages.middleware.MessageMiddleware[source]¶

Bases: object

Middleware that handles temporary messages.

process_request(request)[source]¶
process_response(request, response)[source]¶

Updates the storage backend (i.e., saves the messages).

If not all messages could not be stored and DEBUG is True, a ValueError is raised.

utils¶

django.contrib.messages.utils.get_level_tags()[source]¶

Returns the message level tags.

django.contrib.sitemaps.views.sitemap(request, sitemaps, section=None, template_name='sitemap.xml', mimetype='application/xml')[source]¶

shop_ajax¶

tests¶

This file demonstrates writing tests using the unittest module. These will pass when you run “manage.py test”.

Replace this with more appropriate tests for your application.

post(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

This is to add a new item to the cart. Optionally, you can pass it a quantity parameter to specify how many you wish to add at once (defaults to 1)

compressor¶

base¶

class compressor.base.Compressor(content=None, output_prefix=None, context=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Base compressor object to be subclassed for content type depending implementations details.

cached_filters[source]¶
cachekey[source]¶
filter(content, method, **kwargs)[source]¶
filtered_input(mode='file', forced=False)[source]¶

Passes each hunk (file or code) to the ‘input’ methods of the compressor filters.

filtered_output(content)[source]¶

Passes the concatenated content to the ‘output’ methods of the compressor filters.

get_basename(url)[source]¶
get_filecontent(filename, charset)[source]¶
get_filename(basename)[source]¶
get_filepath(content)[source]¶
handle_output(mode, content, forced)[source]¶
hunks(mode='file', forced=False)[source]¶

The heart of content parsing, iterates of the list of split contents and looks at its kind to decide what to do with it. Should yield a bunch of precompiled and/or rendered hunks.

mtimes[source]¶
output(mode='file', forced=False)[source]¶

The general output method, override in subclass if you need to do any custom modification. Calls other mode specific methods or simply returns the content directly.

output_file(mode, content, forced=False)[source]¶

The output method that saves the content to a file and renders the appropriate template with the file’s URL.

output_inline(mode, content, forced=False)[source]¶

The output method that directly returns the content for inline display.

parser[source]¶
precompile(content, kind=None, elem=None, filename=None, **kwargs)[source]¶
render_output(mode, context=None)[source]¶

Renders the compressor output with the appropriate template for the given mode and template context.

split_contents()[source]¶

To be implemented in a subclass, should return an iterable with four values: kind, value, basename, element

type = None¶

compressor.cache.get_hexdigest(plaintext, length=None)[source]¶

compressor.cache.get_offline_cachekey(source)[source]¶
compressor.cache.get_offline_hexdigest(source)[source]¶

compressor.cache.get_offline_manifest_filename()[source]¶
compressor.cache.get_templatetag_cachekey(compressor, mode, kind)[source]¶

exceptions¶

exception compressor.exceptions.CompressorError[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

A general error of the compressor

exception compressor.exceptions.FilterError[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

This exception is raised when a filter fails

exception compressor.exceptions.OfflineGenerationError[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

Offline compression generation related exceptions

exception compressor.exceptions.ParserError[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

This exception is raised when the parser fails

exception compressor.exceptions.UncompressableFileError[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

This exception is raised when a file cannot be compressed

finders¶

class compressor.finders.CompressorFinder(storage=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: django.contrib.staticfiles.finders.BaseStorageFinder

A staticfiles finder that looks in COMPRESS_ROOT for compressed files, to be used during development with staticfiles development file server or during deployment.

storage¶

class compressor.storage.CompressorFileStorage(location=None, base_url=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: django.core.files.storage.FileSystemStorage

Standard file system storage for files handled by django-compressor.

The defaults for location and base_url are COMPRESS_ROOT and COMPRESS_URL.

accessed_time(name)[source]¶
created_time(name)[source]¶
get_available_name(name)[source]¶

Deletes the given file if it exists.

modified_time(name)[source]¶
class compressor.storage.DefaultStorage[source]¶

Bases: django.utils.functional.LazyObject

class compressor.storage.GzipCompressorFileStorage(location=None, base_url=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: compressor.storage.CompressorFileStorage

The standard compressor file system storage that gzips storage files additionally to the usual files.
